question_content.barrons:question: As used in the passage, dissipated most nearly means
question_content.barrons:explanation:
faded away.

When reasons for refraining from an action dissipate, they disappear or fade away. By 1965, when Huggins determined to write about the Harlem Renaissance, the factors that would have stood in his way had faded away.

Squandered is incorrect. When reasons for refraining from an action dissipate, they do not squander or waste something; instead, they disappear or fade away.

Lavished is incorrect. When reasons for refraining from an action dissipate, they do not lavish or give without limit; instead, they disappear or fade away.

Banished is incorrect. When reasons for refraining from an action dissipate, they do not banish or drive something away; instead, they disappear or fade away.

Worn out is incorrect. When reasons for refraining from an action dissipate, they do not wear out or become impaired from use; instead, they disappear or fade away.
